author: arj
msg: WikiSession receives several under-the-hood changes to improve session stability. The technique used to detect session status changes now includes an explicit check for prior authentication; this should prevent sudden "downgrades" from authenticated status to asserted (cookies). User/login Principals and the status strings (anonymous/asserted/authenticated) are cached now, rather than dynamically calculated. WikiSession gains a new public method, isAsserted() that does what it says. Finally, WikiSession now takes responsibility for populating the JAAS Subject with user profile principals, rather than the various login modules.

author: arj
msg: Fixed the fix for the login-redirection issue, patched in 2.4.60. "Regular" logins (those without a subsequent redirection) now work again. Thanks to the indefatigable Terry Steichen.
